verbose_text: The peripheral location of MCT1 in cervix squamous carcinoma has led to the hypothesis that there can be net production of lactate within a tumor and that some of this is taken up close to the rim as a fuel for oxidative phosphorylation [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
evidence: MCT1 in cervix squamous carcinoma has led to the hypothesis that there can be net production of lactate
